job title: Lead Networking Technology and Security Engineer
job description:
Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us.
The
key roles of Lead Network Technology and Security engineer are:

Provide networking and
network security engineering support to a variety of operational and R&D
projects involving design, development, integration, and implementation
activities

Solve complex networking
and security problems in areas spanning enterprise IT networks, data center
infrastructure, critical infrastructure, network operations, network security,
and more

Collaborate with MITRE,
commercial industry, and government sponsor teams to investigate solutions to
challenging problems

As a Lead
Engineer in the Networking and Infrastructure Technology Center, you might
expect to:

Provide technical
expertise on topics related to networking and network security to wide-ranging
projects across MITRE

Engage with technical
experts from commercial industry, academia, government agencies, and FFRDCs to
identify problems, investigate solutions, and develop consensus on best
solution approaches

Lead efforts that
routinely involve tasks such as tradeoff analyses, design assessments,
lab-based prototyping, and technology/product assessments

Develop written products
and technical reports that highlight findings and recommendations

Work closely with industry to understand best practices and maintain a pulse of
innovations in the networking and network security area

Conduct hands-on lab
analysis to solve technical issues, consider potential integration
opportunities, and understand performance/scalability issues.

Support innovation by identifying areas for research, developing proposals, and leading funded research

Enable good business growth by Leveraging technical expertise to enhance business opportunities with government sponsors

Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s
degree in Electrical, Computer or Systems engineering disciplines and eight
years of technical experience.

Applicants selected for
this position will be subject to a government security investigation and must
meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information

Strong written and verbal communications skills
